Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that election officials did not take a break, but rather worked all night and into the early morning to count the ballots in Wisconsin.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by suggesting that Biden coincidentally came back ahead by 100k after a break, when in reality, the shift in results was due to the processing of mail-in ballots.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to substantiate the assertion that Wisconsin took a break and Biden coincidentally came back ahead.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the delay in reporting results was due to a break taken by election officials, when in fact it was caused by an influx of mail-in ballots.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the shift in results was a result of the processing of mail-in ballots, which tend to skew towards Democrats and were counted later in the process.
